result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Kevin Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joshua T Wegner in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.

Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joshua T Wegner in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  
Court to Address - Conditional Release Plan.

Both State and Defense have received a copy of the Conditional Release Plan.
However, there was never a Guilty find made.

Therefore, Court Vacates the prior NGI findings and Order for Committment.
Matter set for Plea Hearing.
Predisposition Investigation report filed by W.C.S.
Invoice received by Dr. Deborarh Collins. Court approved invoice on 12/8/15.

Order of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).

Review hearing at 02-18-2016 09:00 am

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joshua T Wegner in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  
Court to Address - NGI Evaluation.

All parties have copies of the NGI Evaluation completed by Dr. Collins.
Dr. Collins finds that the defendant was NGI at the time of the offenses.
Neither side is contesting Dr. Collins finds or requesting a second evaluation.

Court finds that the defendant was NGI at the time of the offenses.
Court Orders the following:  Order of Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) and Order for Predisposition Investigation.
Court orders the Predispositional Evaluation be filed by:  02/05/16.
Court signed both orders.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.
  Review hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

State has no objections.
Court Grants - NGI exam under 971.16.
Court appoints Dr. Collins to conduct the exam on an out patient basis.
Exam to be filed by:   11/06/15  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
